data.title: Banc d'Arguin National Park
data.text: The Banc d Arguin National Park of Bay of Arguin lies in Western Africa on the west coast of Mauritania between Nouakchott and Nouadhibou and is the former mouth of the Tamanrasset River The World Heritage Site is a major site for migratory birds and breeding birds including flamingos pelicans and terns Much of the breeding is on sand banks including the islands of Tidra Niroumi Nair Kijji and Arguim The surrounding waters are some of the richest fishing waters in western Africa and serve as nesting grounds for the entire western region
